sen.j: 曳田康貞（ひけたやすさだ、生没年不詳）は鎌倉時代の武士。
sen.e: Yasusada HIKETA (dates of birth and death unknown) was a samurai in the Kamakura period.
Yasusada HIKETA (dates of birth and death unknown) was a samurai who lived during the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 通称・曳田大夫、子に曳田重久。
sen.e: His common name was Daibu HIKETA, and his son was Shigehisa HIKETA.
He was commonly known as Daibu HIKETA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。

sen.j: 平安時代末期に因幡国の豪族の佐治道貞の子として生まれた。
sen.e: Born as the son of Michisada SAJI, a local ruling family in Inaba Province around the end of Heian period.
He was born to Michisada SAJI in the end of Heian period, who was a family member of local ruling family in Inaba Province.
sen.cmt: 文が不完全です。前置詞を変更しました。佐治道貞は佐治家の一員とし言葉を補いました。
sen.e: He was born to Michisada SAJI in the end of Heian period, who was a family member of local ruling family in Inaba Province.

sen.j: 理由は不明だが父の知行する佐治村の郷司職を継がなかった。
sen.e: Although the reason is unknown, he did not succeed the position of Goshi shiki (subdistrict headships) of Saji village which his father ruled.

sen.j: 八上郡曳田郷に所領を持ち、在地名の「曳田」を姓に名乗った。
sen.e: He had territory in Hiketa-go, Yakami-gun and used the name of the local land 'Hiketa' as his family name.

sen.j: 佐治郷を継承した弟の佐治重貞は当時幼少であったため、康貞が長らく佐治郷司職の代行をしていた。
sen.e: Yasusada's younger brother Shigesada SAJI was very young when he took over the Saji-go, Yasusada had been working as Goshi shiki of the Saji-go for his younger brother for a long time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yasusada's younger brother Shigesada SAJI was so young when he took over Saji-go that Yasusada worked as Goshi shiki of the Saji-go instead of his younger brother for a long time.
sen.cmt: 構文，熟語を用いて書き直しました。後半文の時制を変更しました。
sen.e: Yasusada's younger brother Shigesada SAJI was so young when he took over Saji-go that Yasusada worked as Goshi shiki of the Saji-go instead of his younger brother for a long time.

sen.j: しかし弟の成人後も所職を返還せず、実子の重久に譲渡してしまったために鎌倉幕府に訴えられた。
sen.e: However, he did not return the position even after his younger brother reached manhood and gave the position to his own son Shigehisa, and was sued in the Kamakura bakufu Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, without returning the position even after his younger brother reached manhood, Yasusada transferred the position to his son Shigehisa, so that he was sued in the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 熟語を用い書き換えました。Kamakura bakufuの片方を削除しました。
sen.e: However, without returning the position even after his younger brother reached manhood, Yasusada transferred the position to his son Shigehisa, so that he was sued in the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 建暦3年（1213年）11月、争っていた重貞が和田合戦で功を為したのが後押しとなった。
sen.e: In November 1213, the fact that younger brother Shigesada fought well in the Battle of WADA helped the law suit to proceed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The fact that the plaintiff Shigesada performed feats in the Battle of WADA worked favorably to Shigesada in the suit, with the result that Yasusada was obliged to return the position in November 1213 after losing the suit.
sen.cmt: 一文に戻しました。また文のニュアンスが不明瞭なので言葉を補いました。年号が旧暦か新暦か社内チェックをお願いします。
sen.e: The fact that the plaintiff Shigesada performed feats in the Battle of WADA worked favorably to Shigesada in the suit, with the result that Yasusada was obliged to return the position in December 1213 after losing the suit.

sen.j: 訴訟に敗れ、所職を返還した。
sen.e: Yasusada lost the case and returned the position.

sen.j: この後、史料上からは康貞を含む曳田氏の名を確認することはできないため、訴訟に敗れた後、衰退した可能性がある。
sen.e: Since the names of the HIKETA family including Yasusada cannot be found in historical materials afterward, it is possible that this family declined after the loss of the legal case.
